def both_connections
 find number of connections where a linker is involved This is a case where there is a linking connection which can link two particles in some cases we would like to know if the linker is connected at on both/one/none of its connecting sites.

Detailed Description

This module is used to find connections between particle over a series of frames.

Methods for finding connections between particles with one or more sites that can make connections with other particles in the system. A connecing site will be defined as a place where two particles come withing a certain cutoff distance of each other.

Function Documentation

def MD.analysis.connections.both_connections (   con_A,
  con_B 
)

find number of connections where a linker is involved This is a case where there is a linking connection which can link two particles in some cases we would like to know if the linker is connected at on both/one/none of its connecting sites.

Returns:
number of linkers with two sites connected
number of linkers with a single site connected
Parameters:
con_A = list of connections at each time step for site A of the linker
con_B = list of connections at each time step for site B of the linker
def MD.analysis.connections.connections (   A,
  B,
  L,
  rcut = 1.5 
)

Find connections within rcut of each other and return connection numbers.

Parameters:
A numpy matrix of [frames][atoms][x, y, z]
B numpy matrix of [frames][atoms][x, y, z]
L Length of Box
rcut cutoff distance for a connection
def MD.analysis.connections.num_connections (   connections,
  N 
)

Find the number of connections to each particle if you have system whcih has particles which can have many connections, then this will return the average number of connections per particle.

Returns:
array of connections at each frame [frame][number of connections]
Parameters:
connections list of connections at each time step [frame][[p1,p6],[p3,p10]] where p1 and p6 would be two particles with a connection
N the number of of central points which can be connected too ie. spheres with dna attatched where the dna hybridize to other dna N would be the number of spheres
